fields.headline: 'Kiss goodbye to dreams'
fields.bodyText: The anger and resentment at President Kibaki on Kenyan blogs yesterday. "Kibaki finally shows his true colours and grabs power backed by the gun. Kenyans can now kiss goodbye their dreams of a new constitution and the change they have yearned for too long" Orangerevolution.com "Tears are rolling down my eyes as I'm writing this. It is a sad day in Kenya that the democracy that has been painfully and slowly nurtured since 1992 has been damaged in one day." Kenyanpundit.com "If anyone says there was no rigging they must be Kikuyu [Kibaki's ethnic group] because everyone else saw it happening right before their eyes." Kibakiout on zambianchronicle.com "I feel sad that Kenyans optimistically queued on the 27th thinking they could control their destiny and the very people they entrusted spat on their good faith and goodwill." M on blog.thinkersroom.com. "I generally resist phrases such as 'chaos', 'disorder', and 'anarchy' as being used to freely - yet it's hard to think of other descriptors when seeing these images of people passing household appliances out of windows." sheelysheelysheely.blogspot.com
